% Selecting paper size -----------------------------------------------

% The available paper sizes are A0, A1, A2, A3, A4, A5, Letter, Legal,
% Tabloid. You can add an R to each of the sizes to indicate landscape
% instead of the standard portrait orientation.
\def\papersize{A4}




% Single paper slip --------------------------------------------------

% The \singleslip macro gets invoked again and again, until the page
% is full. So if you want to make any modifications to the slip
% itself, this \singleslip macro is the place to add them.

% Setting up the requested paper size --------------------------------

% Checks \papersize agains #1 (resp. #1R). If they match, it sets the
% paper width to #2 (resp. #3) and its height to #3 (resp. #2).
\def\setpapersizeconditional#1#2#3{%
\setpapersizeconditionalhelper{#1}{#2}{#3}%
\setpapersizeconditionalhelper{#1R}{#3}{#2}%
}

% Checks \papersize agains #1. If they match, it sets the
% paper width to #2 and its height to #3.
\def\setpapersizeconditionalhelper#1#2#3{%
% To be able to nicely match using \ifx, we encapsulate #1 in a macro.
\def\setpapersizeconditionaltmp{#1}%
\ifx\papersize\setpapersizeconditionaltmp%
\setlength\paperheight{#3}%
\setlength\paperwidth{#2}%
\setlength{\pdfpageheight}{\paperheight}%
\setlength{\pdfpagewidth}{\paperwidth}%
\fi%
}

% The dimensions to check against
\setpapersizeconditional{A0}{841mm}{1189mm}
\setpapersizeconditional{A1}{594mm}{841mm}
\setpapersizeconditional{A2}{420mm}{594mm}
\setpapersizeconditional{A3}{297mm}{420mm}
\setpapersizeconditional{A4}{210mm}{297mm}
\setpapersizeconditional{A5}{148mm}{210mm}
\setpapersizeconditional{Letter}{8.5in}{11in}
\setpapersizeconditional{Legal}{8.5in}{14in}
\setpapersizeconditional{Tabloid}{11in}{17in}

% Laying out the slips -----------------------------------------------

% To fill a single page with slips all over, it would be nice to
% simply call \singleslip again and again. However, we'd need some
% mechanism to determine when to stop (as we just want to fill a
% /single/ page).
% We use hfill to fill a single line with slips, and vfill to fill the
% page with such lines of slips.
\def\singlelinefill{\leaders\hbox{\raisebox{\dimexpr\depth\relax}{\singleslip}\hspace{5pt}}\hfill}
\def\singleline{\hbox to \hsize{\singlelinefill}}
\def\singlepage{\vbox to \vsize{\leaders\vbox{\singleline\vspace{5pt}}\vfill}}

\begin{document}%
\singlepage%
